text.p: These are significant stories in the Nigerian press on Tuesday. Reuters has not verified these stories and does not vouch for their accuracy.
- Federal government to divest from oil sector soon, Finance Minister Anthony Ani tells seminar in Lagos.
- Investors offload shares on the stock exchange as cash crunch in Nigeria's economy bites harder.
- Nine airforce officers jailed for a total of 588 years for misappropriating public funds.
- International oil firms Exxon and Total jostle to take up 57 percent stake Nigerian government plans to sell off in joint ventures, newspaper's investigations show.
- Shell oil company offers 200 youths employment.
- Finance Minister Ani tells seminar government is willing to undertake further economic reforms to attract foreign investments.
- Military ruler General Sani Abacha asks ministers to prune number of people that accompany them on foreign trips.
- Road tanker drivers threaten strike over continued detention of former national secretary of oil union NUPENG.
- United Bank for Africa recovers 1.1 billion naira bad debts, its chairman Nuhu Bamali tells sharehlders.
